text: at the end of the jurassic and beginning
of the cretaceous period
144 million years ago dinosaurs still
ruled and were getting bigger than ever
many living for 100 years or more a lack
of size was part of an evolutionary
strategy for mammals that enabled them
to survive in the age of dinosaurs
ancient mammals had short lives but that
turned out to be an advantage in their
competition with dinosaurs they have
very short generation time and that they
reproduce fast and the reproduce name
and this is not necessarily a
disadvantage by comparison to large
dinosaurs such as a super source that
may lift up to a hundred years for the
same lifetime mammals will have
reproduced for 50 generations and that
fast and the frequent reproduction would
allow them to adapt to diversify and
eventually lead to their great future
evolutionary success
